text: before AWS I was the data analyst and
software development engineer I was
Elaine a system admin at an investment
bank
my background is in computer science and
I worked as a solution architect for
more than a decade so the great thing
about being an SI is that every single
day is different one day I might be on
site with a customer going through a
workshop together with them and the next
I might be building my own solutions on
top of AWS I try to meet at least one or
two customers in a day it is more about
discussing their new projects or the
ongoing projects some days I spent time
to be Oh POC for my customer some day I
spent to create presentation or blog
posts and some day I spent time at big
conference like reinforce or reinvent to
help customer understand how to operate
on it up yes cloud depending on where
they are in their stage of cloud
adoption they'll either be gaining the
basic benefits of the cloud or really
digging into specific technologies like
serverless architectures I want to help
customer to solve technical problem I
want to help them understand which tool
is right for the right problem then we
provide the solution which suits best to
their requirements and reduces their
cost that is when customer wants to use
AWS more and more and they give us more
opportunities to work with them
you really have to be able to dive into
different technologies and services and
bring that outside perspective to your
customer you need to have customer
obsession where you can put yourself in
the shoes of your customer think about
what challenges they're facing and how
they can address that it is good to know
the use cases of all the AWS services so
that we can map the right product to the
right customer use case it is important
to have some soft skills and the most
important one is to listen to ask
questions to the customers it helps them
know what the exact requirements are and
then we can give the best practices and
good recommendations to be successful in
this role you need to have business
acumen and you need to be right a lot to
help the customer make the right
decision this is a really interesting
role when customers do cool innovations
and create cool stuff and I become a
part of it it really inspires me my
favorite part about being an SI at AWS
is the diversity of my co-workers and
the customers that I work with on a
day-to-day basis at the end of the day
when my customer can successfully deploy
an application ok and innovate a new
type of workload on the cloud is really
make my day
